generic.title: "<?$webhook_result_1.passages[0].passage_text?>"
Highest Number of covid-19 cases in the world respectively as seen in the image(Latest Updated by July)

Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus.  Most people infected with the COVID-19 virus will experience mild to moderate respiratory illness and recover without requiring special treatment.  Older people, and those with underlying medical problems like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer are more likely to develop serious illness.
Hey! Lets get Started
Punjab- Hari Singh || UP- Mohan Yadav || Jharkhand- Rajpal Seth || Tamil Nadu- Sachin Iyer || Assam- Himanta Sarma
Since Pandemic has begun, the situation has become very risky and volatile, If possible we can help our community and join our efforts to follow the measures

ð—™ð—®ð—¿ð—ºð—²ð—¿ð˜€ ð—°ð—®ð—» ð—³ð—¼ð—¹ð—¹ð—¼ð˜„ ð˜ð—µð—² ð—³lð—¼ð—¼ð—± ð—½ð—¿ð—²ð—°ð—®ð˜‚ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð˜€ 1)Do not use produce from plants that have yellowed. 2)Discard vegetable crops flooded with off-farm water that may have been contaminated, 3)particularly leafy vegetable crops. 4)Wash vegetables thoroughly before packing. Facts- after floods or high rainfall, vegetable crops may become a risk to food safety, even if they look healthy.

There are no Medicines or Vaccines for covid-19 presently. However the whole world is trying to make the medicine/vaccine. None have been approved as of now. All the proposed medicines/vaccines are at development/trial stages.
The highest number of cases are seen in the Image(latest update by july)

Rotating crops and embracing diversity. ... Planting cover crops 2) Reducing or eliminating tillage. 3)  Applying integrated pest management (IPM). ..4) Integrating livestock and crops. 5) Adopting agroforestry practices. 6) Managing whole systems and landscapes.
Wheat- Hari Singh || Barley- Mohan Yadav || Tomatoes- Rajpal Seth || Rice- Sachin Iyer || Rice- Himanta Sarma

The goal of sustainable agriculture is to meet societyâ€™s food and textile needs in the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs. Some of them are 1) Addressing Food Insecurity 2)Energy Efficiency & Conservation 3) Organic Farming Agritourism 4) Food and Agricultural Employment 5)Precision Agriculture (SSM) Agroforestry	Food Labeling/Certifications	6) Soil Nutrient Management 7)Biofuels 8)Food Waste Management

values.text:
To learn if you have a current infection, viral tests are used. Most people have mild illness and can recover at home without medical care. Contact your healthcare provider if your symptoms are getting worse or if you have questions about your health.â€‹â€‹
Decisions about testing are made by state and localexternal icon health departments or healthcare providers. You can visit your state or localexternal icon health departmentâ€™s website to look for the latest local information on testing.
If you have symptoms of COVID-19 and want to get tested, call your healthcare provider first.
If you have symptoms of COVID-19 and are not tested, it is important to stay home. What to do if you are sick.
If you have symptoms of COVID-19 and are not tested, it is important to stay home. Learn what to do if you are sick.

COVID-19 affects different people in different ways. Most infected people will develop mild to moderate illness and recover without hospitalization.

Most common symptoms:

fever.
dry cough.
tiredness.
Less common symptoms:

aches and pains.
sore throat.
diarrhoea.
conjunctivitis.
headache.
loss of taste or smell.
a rash on skin, or discolouration of fingers or toes.
Serious symptoms:

difficulty breathing or shortness of breath.
chest pain or pressure.
loss of speech or movement.
Seek immediate medical attention if you have serious symptoms.  Always call before visiting your doctor or health facility. 

People with mild symptoms who are otherwise healthy should manage their symptoms at home. 

On average it takes 5â€“6 days from when someone is infected with the virus for symptoms to show, however it can take up to 14 days.

values.text:
To prevent infection and to slow transmission of COVID-19, do the following:

Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or clean them with alcohol-based hand rub.
Maintain at least 1 metre distance between you and people coughing or sneezing.
Avoid touching your face.
Cover your mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing.
Stay home if you feel unwell.
Refrain from smoking and other activities that weaken the lungs.
Practice physical distancing by avoiding unnecessary travel and staying away from large groups of people.

1. The World Food Summit of 1996 defined that â€œfood security exists when all people, at all times, have physical and economic access to sufficient, safe and nutritious food that meets their dietary needs and preferences for an active life.â€  
2. Food security is built on four pillars: food availability; food access; food use; and food stability. When one of these pillars is unstable or non-existent, people can live in a state of food insecurity.
3. 500 million small farms provide up to 80% of food for most of the developing world. An estimated 400 million smallholder farmers are undernourished.
4. In the world's main tea producing regions more than 30% of children are malnourished. In Malawi, this rises to 50%. 
5. Poverty and drought are the most common causes of food shortages in the world.
6. Smallholder coffee farmers in three Central American countries were found to have no guarantee of food security for 3-4 months every year.
